article: gary ballance 's hundred looks to have closed the door on an england return for kevin pietersen in the near future .
that is the view of former captain andrew flintoff -- with ballance , ian bell and joe root surely all now secure in the middle order for the summer .
former ashes hero flintoff believes pietersen is now ` running out of time ' to resurrect his test career . he will be 35 on june 27 , before the home ashes series starts .
gary ballance produced an outstanding display with the bat against west indies on thursday .
ballance , ian bell and joe root 's form my have shut the door on a test return for kevin piertersen -lrb- above -rrb- .
flintoff said : ` he 's a fantastic player , but nobody just walks into any team -- especially the england team .
` which of the batsmen do you say `` you 're not playing '' for kevin to come in ? i ca n't imagine it 's going to be in the near future . '
flintoff did give his full backing to struggling captain alastair cook , who has had a double failure with the bat in antigua .
` he 's one of the all-time england greats , ' said flintoff .
` and you get the sense everyone within the set-up wants him as captain . he 's a popular lad . '
